name: IoT Summit

venue.name: Moringa School
venue.address_1: Ngong Lane Plaza on Ngong Road

description:
The Workshop will deal with the Internet of Things, providing skills and knowledge about the topic and the opportunity to program real boards in order to develop an IoT project.

The event will feature a Session where developers will get hands-on training and  tracks on relevant technical information on the Internet of Things, Android Things, Google Beacon Platform and the latest microcontroller technologies that they can run their IoT apps on.

They will be  exposed to fundamentals of EE Basics for web developers ,schematics and simple circuits. Theywill  learn deeper concepts of areas such as Input and Outputs( Analog and Digital), Serial Communication & Processing, Interfacing (SPI, Web APIs, I2C, RS232, UARTs), Wireless Communication, Data logging(Firebase)/GCP, Internet Integration and Communication e.tc

Target Audience

Newbies, Intermediate and Advanced Developers

University Students

Entrepreneurs

IT staffs from companies and organization in the city

Anyone else who is passionate and interested in Technology space

Anyone with a curiosity for making electronics

People with an intermediate or no experience knowledge of electronics

name: Google I/O Extended Nairobi
description: As the first Google I/O Extended collaboration by GDG Strathmore, GDG USIU, GDG JKUAT and GDG Nairobi we’re super excited to bring together an audience of enthusiasts, developers and creators on the biggest tech event of the year. Our event will contain codelabs, speaker sessions from Google Developer Experts, and a livestream of the keynote speeches. We believe that this event will act as a way for the tech community in Strathmore University to come together to discuss the progress of technology, learn new things and all in all have a piece of the action at I/O in their local community.
how_to_find_us: Big, bold, bright signs will deck the entrance of the Strathmore University Auditorium, Ole Sangale Road, Madaraka, Nairobi, Kenya.

name: DevFest Nairobi 2017
description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Joining thousands all over the world for the greatest series of DevFest events DevFest Nairobi and Central Google Developer Groups are coming together to have the biggest developer event of the year! aimed at familiarizing attendees (who are members of a variety of developer communities) with groundbreaking technology advancements. We will be working closely with Women Techmakers in this devfest season, to continue improving the diversity in our ecosystem.
how_to_find_us: Find us on maps or reach out to us on meetup or on Facebook at GDG Nairobi.

name: Cloud StudyJam Nairobi

venue.name: Moringa School
venue.address_1: Ngong Lane Plaza on Ngong Road

description:
• What we'll do
Study Jams are back! Join us on the 3rd of February for our Google Cloud Study Jam where we'll be taking on:
-Learning how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
-Learning how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
And at the end of the day you will:
-Get access to Qwiklabs, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
-Get Google-hosted badges for your online profile, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud computing.

• What to bring
Notebook, Laptop, An open mind.

• Important to know
Please feel free to contact us in case of any questions.
how_to_find_us: We're on the 2nd Floor in the Ngong Lane Building along Ngong Lane on Ngong Road.

name: IWD  2018 Extendend Nairobi

venue.name: University of Nairobi
venue.address_1: School of Computing and Informatics Undergraduate lab

description:
In the spirit of International Womens Day, Women Techmakers Communities from all over the world are continuously holding amazing extended events to provide an opportunity for their communities to have an experience of the IWD Summits that were held in various countries all over the world.
Join Women Techmakers Nairobi on 21st April 2018 as they hold an amazing extended event.
Tell a friend and come for inspirational talks, codelabs, sandbox sessions, access to amazing communication building workshops and a customized networking experience.
We can't wait to see you there!

What to bring:
-A positive attitude
-Your Laptop
-Excitement
-A Psyched you
how_to_find_us: Once you get there and you can't find your way, you can give us a call on +254708783230.

name: TensorFlow Dev Summit 2018 Extended Nairobi

venue.name: iHub Nairobi
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Senteu Plaza, Galana / Lenana Road Junction

description:
• What we'll do

TensorFlow Dev Summit extended Nairobi brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around Nairobi for a full day of highly technical live stream sessions, talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow community.

We'll join the TensorFlow team and Machine Learning experts from around the world for the keynote of the summit.

• What to bring

- Notebook
- Laptop
- An open mind

• Important to know

Please feel free to contact us in case of any question(s).

name: Google I/O 2018 Extended Nairobi Viewing Party
description:
Join Thousands of developers around the world as we watch the annual Google I/O live from San Francisco and discuss what this means for the local community.
This will be a teaser for the main Google I/O Extended Nairobi where we'll have codelabs, hands on sessions and keynotes.
So come on down to the Andela Campus as we have a great viewing party with friends.

name: Google I/O Extended Nairobi 2018

venue.name: iHub Nairobi
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Senteu Plaza, Galana / Lenana Road Junction

description: Google I/O Extended Nairobi is an annual developer event held by local GDGs as an extended version of the main I/O conference at San Francisco. Please join us to explore the latest developments in Google technology. We expect a highly technical, in-depth sessions focused on Web, Cloud, IoT , Android, Chrome, AI and more.

name: Google Cloud Next '18 Extended Nairobi

venue.name: iHub Nairobi
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Senteu Plaza, Galana / Lenana Road Junction

description:
Next ’18 Extended Nairobi is an extension of the main conference happening on the 24-26th of July in San Francisco, CA. The local event will entail a recap of the Conference, talks, workshops and panels.

The main objective of the event is to increase awareness and engagement of developers of what they can leverage on Google Cloud Platform.

name: GDG DevFest Nairobi 2018
description:
We are thrilled to announce the biggest Google tech conference in Sub-Saharan Africa. GDG DevFest Nairobi brings together people who are shaping the future of Android, Web, IoT, AI and Cloud technologies for a day of sessions, workshops and networking.

This year, we expect over 1000 engineers, managers, and entrepreneurs from within and outside the country to come to DevFest Nairobi to experience the best of Google technology.

We can't wait to meet you in Nairobi! Stay tuned for more update...

GDG DevFest Nairobi Team.

name: Public Speaking Workshop

venue.name: iHub Nairobi
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Senteu Plaza, Galana / Lenana Road Junction

description:
Did you ever want to give a talk, but didn’t know where to start? Or do you already have some experience already and want to get some additional training? Then this is the right workshop for you.

The facilitators will not only give you the confidence and tools to be comfortable with public speaking but will give you the opportunity to try this out in a safe space and also answer all of your questions.

Hosted by WTM- GDG Nairobi in total collaboration with Google, the workshop is set to take place on 12th of March 2019. Please follow this link to apply as well as a confirmation of your attendance. https://goo.gl/forms/RdI1ogHOSfUgRFBr1

*Please note: As this workshop is only practical up to medium-sized groups, please note that by filling out this application it does not guarantee that you will be selected since we have a limited number of spots. You will hear from us after we close the application on February, 27th.*
how_to_find_us: Please call 0701926294 or just email kaninimalio@gmail.com

name: [Special Event] TensorFlow Dev Summit Viewing Party!

venue.name: iHub Nairobi
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Senteu Plaza, Galana / Lenana Road Junction

description:
#TFDevSummit happens March 6-7, 2019 at the Google Event Center
Sunnyvale, California USA. https://www.tensorflow.org/dev-summit/

Tune in to hear the latest exciting news and updates about TensorFlow and watch the livestream with peer TensorFlow enthusiasts in Nairobi!

Agenda:
=========
3:00 pm: Doors Open
3:30 pm: Networking
4:00 pm: TensorFlow Dev Summit Keynote
5:00 pm: TBA
8:00 pm: Doors Close

Don't miss it. RSVPs will close by March 2. Space is LIMITED! RSVP now.

name: IWD 2019 Extended Nairobi

venue.name: iHub Nairobi
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Senteu Plaza, Galana / Lenana Road Junction

description:
2019 is here and we are already excited. Among the amazing opportunities that comes with the Women Techmakers(WTM) comunities is the International Womens Day(IWD) Celebrations.
Celebrating the women in STEM and beyond, WTM Communities from all over the world are continuously holding incredible extended events to provide an opportunity for their communities to have an experience of the IWD Summits that are held in various countries all over the world.

New year comes early!!!
Join Women Techmakers Nairobi on 30th March 2019 as they hold an amazing extended event.
Tell a friend and come for inspirational talks, hands on codelabs, sandbox sessions, access to amazing communication building workshops and a customized networking experience.

We can't wait to see you there!

What to bring:
-Your Laptop
-A notebook and a Pen
-Excitement
-A friend!!!

Note:
The event is welcome to all.
